gml:Point.gml:name: Tie Point in upper left corner

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Fraction of Vegetation Cover: global 10-daily (raster 333m) - version 1, Apr 2017

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: The Fraction of Vegetation Cover (FCover) corresponds to the fraction of ground covered by green vegetation. Practically, it quantifies the spatial extent of the vegetation. Because it is independent from the illumination direction and it is sensitive to the vegetation amount, FCover is a very good candidate for the replacement of classical vegetation indices for the monitoring of ecosystems. The product at 333m resolution is provided in Near Real Time and consolidated in the next six periods.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: This product is first designed to fit the requirements of the Global component of Land Service of the Copernicus programme. It can be also useful for all applications related to the environment monitoring.

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: FCOVER products were generated by the Global Land Service of Copernicus, the Earth Observation programme of the European Commission. The research leading to the current version of the product has received funding from various European Commission Research and Technical Development programs. The product is based on PROBA-V 333m data (copyright BELSPO and distribution by VITO NV).

gmd:positionName.gco:CharacterString: Copernicus Global Land Service Help Desk

European Commission Directorate-General Joint Research Centre

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: EC DG-JRC Institute for Environment and Sustainability

gmd:fileDescription.gco:CharacterString: Quick-look image of FCOVER layer, with width and height sub-sampled to 5% of their original dataset size.

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: (d) the confidentiality of commercial or industrial information, where such confidentiality is provided for by national or Community law to protect a legitimate economic interest, including the public interest in maintaining statistical confidentiality and tax secrecy.

gmd:attributeDescription.gco:RecordType: Values with bitwise encoded quality information

gml:UnitDefinition.gml:remarks: Root Mean Square Error compared to the daily observations in the compositing period

gmd:attributeDescription.gco:RecordType: LENGTH_BEFORE (length of semi-period before product date)
LENGTH_AFTER (length of semi-period after product date)

gmd:fees.gco:CharacterString: Free by ftp and EUMETCast; cost of medium by DvD or tape

gmd:orderingInstructions.gco:CharacterString: Products can be downloaded online via HTTP (or FTP) or can be received through EUMETCast satellite reception in Europe, Africa and Latin-America. When ordering products from the online archive or subscribing to receive future products, users are informed via e-mail whenever the requested products are ready to be downloaded on the FTP server.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: 1. Search, download and custom order products from Catalogue and Ordering services
2. Subscribe to receive future products via e-mail
3. Register to receive products via EUMETCast

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Validation results conform CEOS LPV guidelines
INSPIRE Data Specification on orthoimagery - Guidelines

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString: The input data are the daily Top of the Atmosphere reflectances measured by the sensor at 1/3 km. The calibrated reflectances are used to calculate instantaneous estimates of the products using a neural network trained with MODIS and CYCLOPES products, removing outliers as clouds and their shadows and atmospherically corrected (SMAC). In a second stage these instantaneous first guess of products are composited using an asymmetric period. The compositing is performing a temporal smooth and gap fill operation based on the land cover type (Evergreen Broadleaf Forest or not).
